channel.title: Hugo on Solutions Architect Resources
channel.description: Recent content in Hugo on Solutions Architect Resources

item.title: Hugo Google Analytics Integration
item.description: Hugo Google Analytics Integration Analytics vs Tags Think of Tag manager as a way for you to manage ALL your ‘tags’ - for Google, Facebook, Google Ads, other ad networks, other analytics, etc If you are happy with Google Analytics and just want Event Tracking … then stick with Google Analytics … and to implement GA event tagging, you just need to update your head.html to include a small script …

item.title: Hugo Google SEO Integration
item.description: Hugo Google SEO Integration SEO Search Engine Optimization. Edit config.toml Edit the title and sitemap. title = 'text to appear ein search' [sitemap] changefreq = "weekly" filename = "sitemap.xml" priority = 0.5 <meta name="keywords" content="{{ if .Params.Keywords }}{{ delimit .Params.Keywords ", " }}{{ end }}"> Edit head partial <meta name="keywords" content="{{ if .Params.Keywords }}{{ delimit .Params.Keywords ", " }}{{ end }}"> Then in your markdown files add keywords for the sarach

item.title: Hugo Layouts
item.description: Layout Index.html First layout to pay attention is the one under the folder layouts/index.html If you need to edit that layout yu can make a copy from themes/whatevertheme/layouts/index.html folder in layouts/index.html Let’s say that your content is shown in 3 columns (size of 4 each one) to 4 Columns (size of 3 each) you can chang as follows <!-- topic-item --> {{ range (where .Site.Pages "Type" "docs") }} <div class="col-lg-3 col-sm-6 mb-4"> Custom CSS You can use your own css files to override de css in use.

item.title: My Hugo
item.description: My Hugo Setup Clone the repo git clone git@github-juaestiv:juaestiv/omega-hugo.git template-hugo rm -rf .git cd public rm -rf .git cd .. cd themes rm -rf dot-hugo cd .. git init git add . git commit -m "before theme" cd themes git submodule add .....
